body_html:
From what I understand, TensorBoard isn't showing logs output, but if you go to the web address, it still shows the GUI.

We recently made some changes to the logging code, that has special cases for Windows.

Is there any chance you could try locally modifying this piece of code right here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/blob/master/tensorboard/util.py#L282 where it says os.name != 'nt'? We might need to update this, or something related.
body_text:
From what I understand, TensorBoard isn't showing logs output, but if you go to the web address, it still shows the GUI.
We recently made some changes to the logging code, that has special cases for Windows.
Is there any chance you could try locally modifying this piece of code right here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/blob/master/tensorboard/util.py#L282 where it says os.name != 'nt'? We might need to update this, or something related.
body:
From what I understand, TensorBoard isn't showing logs output, but if you go to the web address, it still shows the GUI.

We recently made some changes to the logging code, that has special cases for Windows.

Is there any chance you could try locally modifying this piece of code right here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/blob/master/tensorboard/util.py#L282 where it says `os.name != 'nt'`? We might need to update this, or something related.
